qas.question: When was Morphine and Quinine first available?
Who was the compound named after?
Where were was Morphine extracted from?
Who is responsible for purification of compounds found in mineral sources?
Who came up with the name Morphine?
Morphine was named after what Greek god?
Burroughs-Wellcome is now part of what medical company?
What is the name of the plant that produces morphine?
Who is responsible for purification of Glaxo found in mineral sources?
Who came up with the name Glaxo?

context: The modern pharmaceutical industry traces its roots to two sources. The first of these were local apothecaries that expanded from their traditional role distributing botanical drugs such as morphine and quinine to wholesale manufacture in the <a0_0>mid 1800s<a0_0/>. Rational drug discovery from plants started particularly with the isolation of morphine, analgesic and sleep-inducing agent from <a2_0><a8_0><b11_0>opium<b11_0/><a8_0/><a2_0/>, by the German apothecary assistant <a4_0><a7_0><b13_0>Friedrich Sertürner<b13_0/><a7_0/><a4_0/>, who named the compound after the Greek god of dreams, <a1_0><a5_0><b10_0>Morpheus<b10_0/><a5_0/><a1_0/>. Multinational corporations including Merck, Hoffman-La Roche, Burroughs-Wellcome (now part of <a6_0>Glaxo Smith Kline<a6_0/>), Abbott Laboratories, Eli Lilly and Upjohn (now part of Pfizer) began as local apothecary shops in the <b9_0>mid-1800s<b9_0/>. By the late 1880s, <a3_0><b12_0>German dye manufacturers<b12_0/><a3_0/> had perfected the purification of individual organic compounds from coal tar and other mineral sources and had also established rudimentary methods in organic chemical synthesis. The development of synthetic chemical methods allowed scientists to systematically vary the structure of chemical substances, and growth in the emerging science of pharmacology expanded their ability to evaluate the biological effects of these structural changes.
